references.paper_title: Causalvae: Structured causal disentanglement in variational autoencoder
references.reason: This paper is foundational for the concept of causal disentanglement in variational autoencoders, a technique relevant to identity preservation in video generation.
This paper significantly advances diffusion models, which are central to the current state-of-the-art in image and video generation, by making them more scalable with transformers.

references.paper_title: Adding conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models
references.reason: This work introduces conditional control to text-to-image diffusion models, a key improvement relevant to controlling attributes and identity in generated videos.
This paper presents a state-of-the-art method for identity-preserving video generation, directly addressing the core problem tackled by the target paper.

references.paper_title: Identity-preserving text-to-video generation by frequency decomposition
references.reason: This paper is highly relevant as it focuses on identity preservation in text-to-video generation, directly competing with and informing the methods of the target paper.
